oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Residence Course Flyer, 1933-1934
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Flyer requesting applications for Highlander's five-month residence course from December 1, 1933- May 1, 1934. This flyer is geared toward workers from Cumberland Plateau coal mines and mill towns who "feel that working conditions could be made better, and would like to help make them better." Classes include Economics, History, Public Speaking, and Shop Work.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Coal mines and mining--Labor productivity; Coal miners--Labor unions; Residence and education; Labor unions and education; Strikes and lockouts
